description.narrative: The Pacific Financial Inclusion Program (PFIP) is a regional, multi-donor program administered by the UNCDF and the UNDP. The program plays a catalytic role in expanding access to financial services for rural and low-income women, men and youth. PFIP currently works in six (6) Pacific island countries – Papua New Guinea, Solomon Islands, Vanuatu, Fiji, Tonga and Samoa. The recent Independent Mid-term review found that PFIP significantly contributed to an overall increase in access to finance in the Pacific since the launch of the program in July 2008 has enrolled cumulatively, 1.8 million people (by December 2017) PFIP aligns with Australia’s commitments to promoting inclusive growth under the Foreign Policy White Paper, Furthermore, Pacific policy makers and regulators recognise PFIP’s support to the development and implementation of their financial inclusion agendas. The total value of this investment is $31.2million over 11 years, starting 2009-10.
